attributes_added.label: attr-lipschitz-projection
attributes_added.expression: For $(x,v),(x',v')\in\mathbb R^d\times\mathbb R^d$ the projection $\varphi(x,v)=(\psi_x(x),\psi_v(v))$ satisfies $d_{\mathcal Y}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}\bigl(\varphi(x,v),\varphi(x',v')\bigr)\le L_{\varphi}\,\sqrt{\|x-x'\|^2+\lambda_v\|v-v'\|^2}$ with Lipschitz constant $L_{\varphi}\le\max\{1,\sqrt{\lambda_v}\}$.

relations_established.label: rel-projection-squashing-embedding
relations_established.expression: The projection $\varphi: \mathbb{R}^d \times \mathbb{R}^d \to B(0,R_x) \times B(0,V_{\mathrm{alg}})$ embeds the physical state space into the bounded algorithmic space with Lipschitz control in the Sasaki metric.

properties.label: lipschitz-constant-bound
properties.description: The Lipschitz constant depends on the velocity weight parameter

theorem_inputs.role: The composition map $\varphi(x,v) = (\psi_x(x), \psi_v(v))$ whose Lipschitz constant we are bounding
Positional squashing map $\psi_x: \mathbb{R}^d \to B(0,R_x)$ with 1-Lipschitz property from lem-squashing-properties-generic
Velocity squashing map $\psi_v: \mathbb{R}^d \to B(0,V_{\mathrm{alg}})$ with 1-Lipschitz property from lem-squashing-properties-generic
The metric $d_{\mathcal{Y}}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}((y_x,y_v),(y'_x,y'_v))^2 = \|y_x - y'_x\|^2 + \lambda_v \|y_v - y'_v\|^2$ used to measure distance in algorithmic space

theorem_outputs.description: The projection is Lipschitz continuous with respect to the Sasaki metric
Explicit bound on the Lipschitz constant depending on velocity weight

proof_sketch.strategy: Use the 1-Lipschitz property of individual squashing maps from lem-squashing-properties-generic, then apply the definition of the Sasaki metric to obtain the composite bound.

steps.description: Apply lem-squashing-properties-generic to get $\|\psi_x(x) - \psi_x(x')\| \le \|x - x'\|$ and $\|\psi_v(v) - \psi_v(v')\| \le \|v - v'\|$
Substitute the Lipschitz bounds: $\le \|x - x'\|^2 + \lambda_v \|v - v'\|^2$
Determine optimal constant: $L_{\varphi} = 1$ if $\lambda_v \le 1$, else $L_{\varphi} = \sqrt{\lambda_v}$, yielding the bound $\le L_{\varphi}^2 (\|x-x'\|^2 + \lambda_v \|v-v'\|^2)$
Take square roots to obtain the final inequality

mathematical_content.statement:
For $(x,v),(x',v')\in\mathbb{R}^d\times\mathbb{R}^d$ the projection $\varphi(x,v)=(\psi_x(x),\psi_v(v))$ satisfies
$$
d_{\mathcal{Y}}^{\mathrm{Sasaki}}\bigl(\varphi(x,v),\varphi(x',v')\bigr)\le L_{\varphi}\,\sqrt{\|x-x'\|^2+\lambda_v\|v-v'\|^2},
$$
with Lipschitz constant $L_{\varphi}\le\max\{1,\sqrt{\lambda_v}\}$.

key_constants.description: Velocity weight parameter in Sasaki metric

framework_role.continuity_analysis: Establishes Lipschitz control for projection map, enabling Sasaki metric-based continuity bounds throughout the framework
